p: A challenge is to link these expression changes to adaptive variation in plasticity; population differences in gene expression under different conditions may indicate adaptive changes in plasticity, but expression changes have not yet been clearly linked mechanistically to such changes. One problem in making such connections is that there is a level of complexity in organism's transcriptome that largely remains to be explored even in model organisms. For instance, in D. melanogaster, the transcriptome can be modified qualitatively in a variety of ways, such as through alternative splicing and expression of alternative isoforms, that may ultimately have more impact on plastic responses than quantitative changes in gene expression. These sources of variation for climate adaptation are only just starting to be explored (Telonis-Scott etÂ al. 2013).
